ai-mn42:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn42:2.1_0: Now at that time the brahmins and householders of Verañja were residing in Sāvatthī on some business.
ai-mn42:2.2_0: The brahmins and householders of Verañja heard:
ai-mn42:2.3_0: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn42:2.5_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn42:2.6_0: He realizes with his own insight this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.
ai-mn42:2.7_0: He proclaims a teaching that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing.
ai-mn42:2.7_1: and explains the spiritual life which is complete, full and pure.
ai-mn42:2.8_0: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”
ai-mn42:3.1_0: Then the brahmins and householders of Verañja went up to the Fortunate One,
ai-mn42:3.1_1: some, after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, sat down on one side.
ai-mn42:3.1_2: Before sitting down to one side, some bowed, some exchanged greetings and polite conversation, some held up their joined palms toward the Buddha, some announced their name and clan, while some kept silent.
ai-mn42:3.1_3: Some, after raising their hands in respectful salutation to the Fortunate One, sat down on one side.
ai-mn42:3.1_4: Some, after announcing their name and family in the presence of the Fortunate One, sat down on one side.
ai-mn42:3.1_5: Some, while keeping silent, sat down on one side.
ai-mn42:3.1_6: Before sitting down to one side, some bowed, some exchanged greetings and polite conversation, some held up their joined palms toward the Buddha, some announced their name and clan, while some kept silent. Seated to one side they said to the Buddha:
ai-mn42:4.1_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?
ai-mn42:4.2_0: And what is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
ai-mn42:5.1_0: “Unprincipled and immoral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn42:5.2_0: Principled and moral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
ai-mn42:6.1_0: “We don’t understand the detailed meaning of Master Gotama’s brief statement.
ai-mn42:6.2_0: Master Gotama, please teach us this matter in detail so we can understand the meaning.”
ai-mn42:6.3_0: “Well then, householders, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn42:7.1_0: “Householders, unprincipled and immoral conduct is threefold by way of body, fourfold by way of speech, and threefold by way of mind.
ai-mn42:8.1_0: And how is unprincipled and immoral conduct threefold by way of body?
ai-mn42:8.2_0: It’s when a certain person kills living creatures.
ai-mn42:8.2_1: a hunter, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.
ai-mn42:8.3_1: Whatever wealth and provisions belong to another,
ai-mn42:8.4_0: They commit sexual misconduct. They have sex with women who have their mother, father, both mother and father, brother, sister, relatives, or clan as guardian.
ai-mn42:8.5_0: This is how unprincipled and immoral conduct is threefold by way of body.
ai-mn42:9.1_0: And how is unprincipled and immoral conduct fourfold by way of speech?
ai-mn42:9.2_0: It’s when a certain person lies.
ai-mn42:9.4_0: They speak harshly. They use the kinds of words that are cruel, nasty, hurtful, offensive, bordering on ...
ai-mn42:9.5_0: They talk nonsense. Their speech is untimely, and is neither factual nor beneficial.
ai-mn42:9.6_0: That’s how unprincipled and immoral conduct is fourfold by way of speech.
ai-mn42:10.1_0: And how is unprincipled and immoral conduct threefold by way of mind?
ai-mn42:10.2_0: It’s when a certain person is covetous.’
ai-mn42:10.3_0: They have ill will and malicious intentions: ‘It’s not proper for you to think: ‘May these sentient beings be killed and those who don’t get all by.’
ai-mn42:10.4_0: They have wrong view. Their perspective is distorted:
ai-mn42:10.5_0: there’s no meaning in giving, etc.
ai-mn42:10.6_0: That’s how unprincipled and immoral conduct is threefold by way of mind.
ai-mn42:10.7_0: That’s how unprincipled and immoral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn42:11.1_0: Principled and moral conduct is threefold by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn42:12.1_0: And how is principled and moral conduct threefold by way of body?
ai-mn42:12.2_0: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.
ai-mn42:12.3_1: he does not steal whatever has not been given.
ai-mn42:12.5_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is threefold by way of body.
ai-mn42:13.1_0: And how is principled and moral conduct fourfold by way of speech?
ai-mn42:13.2_0: It’s when a certain person gives up lying.
ai-mn42:13.2_2: does he speak words that amount to false speech.
ai-mn42:13.5_0: Giving up talking nonsense, she times at the right time, beneficially or harmful.
ai-mn42:13.6_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is fourfold by way of speech.
ai-mn42:14.1_0: And how is principled and moral conduct threefold by way of mind?
ai-mn42:14.2_0: It’s when a certain person is content.
ai-mn42:14.2_1: They don’t covet the wealth and belongings of others:
ai-mn42:14.2_2: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’
ai-mn42:14.3_0: They have a kind heart and loving intentions:
ai-mn42:14.3_1: ‘May these sentient beings live free of enmity and ill will, untroubled and happy!’
ai-mn42:14.4_0: They have right view, an undistorted perspective:
ai-mn42:14.5_0: there is meaning in giving, etc.
ai-mn42:14.6_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is threefold by way of mind.
ai-mn42:14.7_0: This is how principled and moral conduct is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-mn42:15.1_0: If they wish, householders, living in Dhamma,
ai-mn42:15.2_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats!’
ai-mn42:15.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:15.5_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.
ai-mn42:16-17.1_0: If they wish, householders, living in Dhamma,
ai-mn42:16-17.2_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do brahmins ...
ai-mn42:16-17.4_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:16-17.6_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.

ai-mn42:18-42.2_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods of the Four Great Kings!’
ai-mn42:18-42.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.5_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.
ai-mn42:18-42.6_0: If they wish, householders, living in Dhamma,
ai-mn42:18-42.10_0: the Gods Who Love to Create ...
ai-mn42:18-42.11_0: the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others ...
ai-mn42:18-42.13_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.15_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.

ai-mn42:18-42.18_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.20_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.
ai-mn42:18-42.21_0: If they wish, householders, living in Dhamma,
ai-mn42:18-42.34_0: the gods of the dimension of infinite space ...
ai-mn42:18-42.35_0: the gods of the dimension of infinite consciousness ...
ai-mn42:18-42.36_0: the gods of the dimension of nothingness ...
ai-mn42:18-42.37_0: the gods of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.’
ai-mn42:18-42.38_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:18-42.40_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.
ai-mn42:43.1_0: If they wish, householders, living in Dhamma,
ai-mn42:43.2_0: ‘If only I might realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-mn42:43.3_0: It’s possible that this might happen.
ai-mn42:43.5_0: Because they have principled and moral conduct.”
ai-mn42:44.1_0: When he had spoken, the brahmins and householders of Verañja said to the Buddha,
ai-mn42:44.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-mn42:44.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-mn42:44.3_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-mn42:44.4_0: We go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-mn42:44.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”
ai-mn42:44.6_0: The second chapter on Verañja is finished.
